intro: Cologania biloba, commonly known as the two-lobed cologania, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Cologania biloba is often found in shaded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
